content.question: A tube is being stretched while maintaining its cylindrical shape. The height is increasing at the rate of 2 millimeters per second. At the instant that the radius of the tube is 6 millimeters, the volume is increasing at the rate of <math alttext="96 pi" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>96</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> cubic millimeters per second. Which of the following statements about the surface area of the tube is true at this instant? (The volume <math alttext="V" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of a cylinder with radius <math alttext="r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and height <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="V equals, pi times r squared, times h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>V</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>π</mi><msup><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. The surface area <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>of a cylinder, not including the top and bottom of the cylinder, is <math alttext="S equals, 2 pi, times r h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mi>r</mi><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.)

choices.label: The surface area is increasing by <math alttext="28 pi" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>28</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> square millimeters per second.
The surface area is decreasing by <math alttext="28 pi" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>28</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> square millimeters per second.
The surface area is increasing by <math alttext="32 pi" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>32</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> square millimeters per second.
The surface area is decreasing by <math alttext="32 pi" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>32</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> square millimeters per second.

content.answer: The surface area is increasing by <math alttext="28 pi" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>28</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> square millimeters per second.
